sources.snippet: Located about 7 km from Gangtok and placed strategically on an elevated ridge, Ganesh Tok offers panoramic vistas of the sprawling Gangtok city and the breathtaking Himalayan landscape that includes mountain peaks such as Mt. Khangchendzonga and Mt. Siniolchu. The view is one that will take your breath away with incredible views of snow-capped mountains looming over the horizon of the quaint and picturesque Gangtok city. Something which you definitely do not want to miss!.

reviews.reviewText: The atmosphere was wonderful. One could actually feel the positivity which is present in a divine place. The state flower of Sikkim could be seen everywhere. They were a couple of tourists getting there picture clicked with the traditional dresses of this place. I would suggest everyone to try to look at the wonderful sceneries as well. One could see the whole Gangtok from up there. There are a few shops outside the temple, they offer aesthetic items as well apart from the offerings for worship.

Ganesh Tok, located in Gangtok, is a hidden gem that offers one of the most surreal and soul-soothing experiences in Sikkim. Tucked away on a hilltop, this small yet charming temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha isn't just a place of worship—it’s a window to the heavens.

The first thing that strikes you as you arrive is the sheer beauty of the surroundings. The atmosphere is peaceful, the air crisp and clean, and the views—absolutely mesmerizing. From here, you get a panoramic view of the lush green hills and valleys that define the landscape of Gangtok. But what truly sets Ganesh Tok apart is the majestic view of Mount Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world. When the sky is clear and the early morning sun begins to rise, the snow-capped peaks of Kanchenjunga glow in golden hues, creating a picture-perfect moment that stays etched in your memory forever.

The best time to visit Ganesh Tok is between March and June, especially during the early morning hours of 7 AM to 9 AM. During this time, the skies are generally clear, and the light is perfect for photography. The serenity of the place, combined with the soft chants from the temple and the cool mountain breeze, creates a truly spiritual and calming experience.

Apart from the views, the area around the temple is well-maintained and offers a peaceful vibe.

⬜ Beautiful and peaceful temple — Ganesh Tok is a small temple perched at around 6,500 ft. It’s quiet and has a spiritual feel that’s soothing to the heart.  ￼ ￼

⬜ Amazing view of Gangtok city — From the circular balcony and viewing lounge, you get a bird’s-eye view of the town, rolling hills, and, on clear days, the snow-capped Kanchenjunga. It’s truly breathtaking.  ￼ ￼

⬜ Climb adds to the charm — You reach the viewpoint via a steep staircase decorated with colorful prayer flags—it almost feels like walking through a rainbow.  ￼ ￼

⬜ A place of faith and culture — The temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha and is visited by many pilgrims seeking blessings or simply a peaceful moment amid beautiful surroundings.  ￼ ￼

⬜ Other things to check out nearby — There are small gift shops, snack stalls, and a gift shop in the complex. Plus, a short walk away is the zoo if you want to explore more.  ￼ ￼

⬜ Perfect for spiritual or scenic stops — Whether you are looking to pray, enjoy breathtaking views, or just relax in nature, Ganesh Tok delivers beautifully. It’s easy to reach by taxi and worth the visit.  ￼ ￼

Ganesh Tok is one of those magical places that lifts your spirit and leaves you longing to return. A definite must-visit in Gangtok!

Ganesh Tok, Gangtok – Short Review:

Ganesh Tok offers a serene and spiritual escape with stunning panoramic views of Gangtok and the surrounding Himalayan peaks. The peaceful temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha is small but charming, and the viewpoint nearby makes it a must-visit spot for photography and relaxation. Clean, well-maintained, and scenic — perfect for a quick stop during your Gangtok trip.

Ganesh Tok is a Hindu temple and a popular viewpoint located on a ridge in Gangtok, Sikkim. It is known for its panoramic views of the entire Gangtok town, the rolling hills, and the majestic Kanchenjunga and Mt. Siniolchu mountain ranges. The complex includes a circular viewing lounge and a balcony that offer exceptional views of the surrounding natural beauty. It is a popular spot for photography, especially during clear weather.

placeMetadata.name: Do Drul Chorten

sources.snippet: Do-Drul Chorten is an important Buddhist stupa that was built in 1945 by Trulshik Rinpoche, the head of the Nyingma order of Tibet Buddhism, This enormous stupa is believed to have around 108 prayer wheels (Mani Lhakor) engraved with mantras that are chanted by devotees while rotating them. Inside the stupa is the complete set of Dorjee Phurba, religious books,  texts and other objects. a quiet and serene locale, Do-Drul Chorten is one of the best places to visit in Gangtok for those who love to explore Buddhist sites and monasteries.

sources.snippet: A short walking distance away from the Namgyal Institute, lies one of the most important chortens (Buddhist shrine) of Sikkim, Do Drul Chorten Stupa!. The iconic Buddhist monument is located on a hillock in the Deorali area of Gangtok town and requires a steep uphill walk to reach this place. Although the climb could be a little taxing, the experience one gets at this peaceful monument is equally rewarding accompanied by scenic views from the top.

reviews.reviewText: Do Drul Chorten is an absolutely amazing place to visit. The sense of peace and equanimity I felt while visiting here was overwhelming. There are a steady flow of visitors mixed with Buddhist lamas here and the environment was friendly and welcoming. It is located about 500 meters from Namgyal institute of Tibetology and definitely worth the visit if you’re in Gangtok.

Do Drul Chorten is an absolutely amazing place to visit. The chorten means Buddhist Shrine is beautifully maintained, and its golden dome shines gracefully. The place is surrounded by 108 prayer wheels, which visitors can spin while walking around the structure. It is pleasant and feeling peaceful to observe the monks in their daily worship, reflecting a way of life, beauty of simplicity and devotion. Here I found that they have separate small room where they kept burning lamps for departed souls. Must visit place in Gangtok.

Highly recommended for history lovers and photographers.

Our recent family visit to Do-Drul Chorten Monastery was a truly enriching experience. Nestled amidst serene surroundings, this monastery is a haven of tranquility. The intricate architecture of the stupa and the spiritual ambiance left us in awe. We were fascinated to observe the monks in their daily worship, reflecting a way of life so different from the fast-paced routines most of us are accustomed to.

The chants resonating through the air and the scent of incense created a meditative atmosphere, inviting visitors to pause and reflect. The surrounding views of the lush hills added to the charm, making it an ideal spot for those seeking peace and insight into Buddhist culture.

The monastery not only offered a glimpse into a unique lifestyle but also reminded us of the beauty of simplicity and devotion. It’s a must-visit for anyone in search of spiritual and cultural inspiration.

I had the wonderful opportunity to visit Do Drul Chorten in March, located in the heart of Gangtok, Sikkim. This sacred stupa is one of the most significant landmarks of Buddhist culture in the region and offers a deeply spiritual and serene experience.

As I approached the stupa, I was immediately struck by the peaceful and positive atmosphere that surrounds the area. The chorten (stupa) is beautifully maintained, and its golden dome shines gracefully against the backdrop of Sikkim’s natural beauty. The place is surrounded by 108 prayer wheels, which visitors can spin while walking around the structure—a meditative and calming activity that added to the overall spiritual vibe.

The surroundings are very clean, quiet, and well-organized, creating a sense of peace and tranquility. You can really feel the spiritual energy of the place, making it ideal not only for followers of Buddhism but for anyone seeking a moment of calm and reflection.

Do Drul Chorten is a must-visit if you're in Gangtok. It’s not just a tourist spot, but a place where you can genuinely connect with inner peace and take in the positive energy that flows throughout the area. I left feeling refreshed, grounded, and grateful for the experience.

It offers stunning views of the surrounding valleys and hills, a short walk from central Gangtok and can be easily included in a day tour of the city. The stupa stands tall with a golden dome that shines brilliantly under the sun, surrounded by 108 prayer wheels inscribed with Om Mani Padme Hum.

Do Drul Chorten is one of the most serene and spiritually uplifting places in Gangtok. Located on a hilltop, this stupa is a must-visit for those seeking peace and a glimpse into Tibetan Buddhist culture. The golden spire of the stupa is striking, and the surrounding prayer wheels add to the tranquil atmosphere.

The site is well-maintained, and the monks here are welcoming, making it a great place for meditation or quiet reflection. The panoramic views of Gangtok from this spot are also a bonus. While reaching the chorten requires a short uphill walk, it’s worth the effort.

Overall, Do Drul Chorten is a beautiful and peaceful spiritual landmark that offers a break from the bustling city life. Highly recommended for history lovers, photographers, and those in search of inner peace.

Do Drul Chorten or Do Drul Stupa ,Is located Near Namgyal Institute of Tibetology NIT at Deorali Gangtok sikkim.

The surroundings of this Chorten is simply soul stirring.
Minute you leave crowded area of Deorali, and enter the gate , you will be passing through long rows of trees,and lush green peaceful mountains,the scenery is breathtaking.
The chorten is surrounded by a monastery with cabins for monks who come to study.

There are chanting rooms, where monks will be chanting prayers, the sound of chanting spiritually lifts spirit.
During auspicious occasions, you may volunteer to offer some fund in their office and request prayers for your loved ones,sometimes they comply and you will hear monks chanting prayers for you and your loved ones, such moment is heart rendering.
Also they have separate enclosure for burning lamps for departed souls, you may buy and lit lamp.
Such act  renders calm and peaceful feeling.
Under renovation. Not much to see. No entrance fees or parking fees as of now.

reviews.reviewText:
During our local sightseeing day in Gangtok, one of the highlights was our visit to the stunning Tashi View Point. Nestled on a hilltop, this spot offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the surrounding mountains and valleys, making it a perfect place to relax and soak in the beauty of Sikkim.
As we reached the viewpoint, we were welcomed by a cool breeze and clear skies. The view was absolutely mesmerizing – the lush green hills, scattered clouds, and distant mountain peaks made it feel like a dream. We took our time clicking photos, trying to capture the incredible scenery and moments together.
One of the most fun parts of our visit was dressing up in the traditional Sikkimese attire available at the viewpoint. Wearing the vibrant local dress and taking pictures gave us a sense of the local culture and made the experience even more memorable. It was exciting to see ourselves in colorful traditional clothing against such a beautiful backdrop.
The place had a peaceful vibe, and though it was a popular spot, it didn’t feel overcrowded. We enjoyed spending time together, laughing, taking photos, and just enjoying the moment. Tashi View Point is a must-visit during a trip to Gangtok, especially if you love nature and scenic views. It offered us a perfect blend of culture, fun, and stunning natural beauty. Visiting with friends made it even more special – a day I’ll always remember fondly
From Tashi view point we can see kanchenjunga mountain range if weather is clear. Else here you can have photo with traditional Sikkim dress.

Tashi Viewpoint is one of the most popular attractions in Gangtok, offering a breathtaking panoramic view of the Kanchenjunga mountain range and the surrounding valleys. Located about 8 km from Gangtok, it is a must-visit spot for nature lovers, photographers, and those who enjoy peaceful scenic landscapes.

How to Reach Tashi Viewpoint

By Taxi: The easiest way to reach Tashi Viewpoint is by hiring a local taxi from Gangtok, which takes about 20-30 minutes. Shared cabs are also available.

By Private Vehicle: If you're on a road trip, you can drive up to the viewpoint via the North Sikkim Highway.

By Walking/Trekking: For adventure enthusiasts, a hike from Gangtok to Tashi Viewpoint can be a rewarding experience, though it may take a couple of hours.

Best Time to Visit

The best time to visit Tashi Viewpoint is early in the morning, preferably before sunrise, as the clear skies provide a spectacular view of the snow-capped Kanchenjunga peaks.

October to April is ideal for stunning mountain views, while monsoon months (July-August) might obscure the peaks due to clouds.

Things to Do at Tashi Viewpoint

Enjoy the Scenic View: Witness the grandeur of Kanchenjunga and the surrounding valleys. On clear days, you can also spot Phodong Monastery and Labrang Monastery.

Photography: The viewpoint is a paradise for photographers, especially during sunrise.

Telescopic View: There’s a small paid telescope facility for a closer look at the mountains and distant monasteries.

Tea & Snacks: Local vendors sell tea, coffee, and light snacks like momos and Maggi—perfect for a cozy break in the cold weather.

Souvenir Shopping: There are small stalls selling handicrafts, woolen items, and traditional Sikkimese goods.

Entry Fees & Timings

Entry Fee: Free

Timings: Open all day, but visiting between 5:00 AM – 7:00 AM is best for sunrise views.

Travel Tips
✔ Dress warmly, as it can be chilly, especially in the early morning.
✔ Check the weather forecast before visiting to ensure clear mountain views.
✔ Carry cash for small expenses, as digital payments may not always be accepted.
✔ Plan your visit as part of a half-day tour including places like Ganesh Tok and Hanuman Tok nearby.

Conclusion
Tashi Viewpoint is an unmissable spot in Gangtok, offering one of the finest views of the Himalayas. Whether you’re a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or just someone looking for a peaceful escape, this viewpoint is a perfect addition to your Sikkim itinerary.

It is a spectacular viewpoint located in Gangtok. The majestic view of Mountain Kanchenjunga can be seen from here 😍😍

Tashi View Point is a popular destination in Gangtok, Sikkim, known for its panoramic views of the Himalayan peaks. From this spot, visitors can witness breathtaking views of Mount Kanchenjunga, the third-highest peak in the world, as well as Mount Siniolchu. The spot is particularly famous for its sunrise and sunset views. As the sun rises, the snow-capped peaks change color, offering a dazzling visual treat. The viewpoint provides a peaceful setting for nature lovers to enjoy the serene environment away from the city's hustle and bustle.
Breathtaking 360-degree views of the Kanchenjunga range, serene atmosphere, and stunning sunset views make Tashi View Point unforgettable.

placeMetadata.name: Namgyal Institute of Tibetology

sources.snippet: A place where Tibetan Buddhism is studied and preserved in depth, the Namgyal Institute of Tibetology is a popular attraction in Gangtok. Since the region is heavily influenced by Tibetan Buddhism, understanding it is a great way to understand the motivations of the local population Namgyal Institute of Tibetology allows visitors to do just this.Beautiful Tibetan architecture defines the building and its museum houses several statues, coins, scrolls with hand paintings & embroidery work (thangkas), Tibetan artworks and artefacts, as well as ancient manuscripts in Sanskrit, Tibetan, Chinese and Lepcha. The library of the Institute houses over 60,000 books among which are the original teachings of Lord Buddha.
sources.shortName: 30 Places to Visit in Gangtok 2024, Tourist Places & Attractions

sources.snippet: One of the most prestigious places to visit in Gangtok and a true reflection of Tibet culture!. The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology is a Tibetan museum established with the purpose of promoting research of the religion, history, language, art and culture of the people of the Tibetan cultural area which includes Sikkim. It is home to some of the most iconic treasures of Buddhism that include a vast collection of rare Lepcha, Tibetan and Sanskrit manuscripts, valuable statues and rare Thankas (colourful tapestries used in Buddhist places of worship).
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions - Best Places to Visit in Gangtok,Sikkim

sources.snippet: One of the popular Gangtok tourist places, the Namgyal Institute of Tibetology is an important place of study and research for Tibet and Buddhist culture and history. The museum and the library are the main attractions of NIT showcasing carefully preserved religious and cultural artefacts that mainly include statues, paintings, coins, thangkas (embroidery) and Tibetan artworks. An incredible example of Tibetan architecture, NIT has a huge facade, huge golden towers and intricately designed frescos.
sources.shortName: 15 Spectacular Places to Visit in Gangtok For a Memorable Holiday

sources.snippet: A glimpse into the past of a very intriguing culture, the Namgyal Institute of Tibetology is a must if you are passionate about history or interested in learning more about Buddhism. Presenting a large collection of works of art, objects, manuscripts, souvenirs, and one of the largest collections of Tibetan documents and literature in the world, this institute is responsible for all the important things for Tibetan culture. 14th Dalai Lama has laid the foundation stone of this institute.

reviews.reviewText:
I’ve had the pleasure of visiting the The Namgyal Institute of Tibetology (NIT), Gangtok, Sikkim in January, 2025 and must say that I thoroughly enjoyed the visit!. The NIT is meticulously maintained and the staff are very friendly. Admission is 25 Rs and well worth it. The exhibits are very well preserved and displayed with an explanation in English placed next to each artefact. A wonderful showcase of Buddhism faith and culture. Well worth the visit

is an important reference centre in the world of Buddhist scholarship. It houses a museum, a Tibetan library and a general reference and research centre on Tibet, Sikkim and the Himalayas.
The Institute is located in Deorali, to the south of central Gangtok. The opening hours are from 10 am to 4:30 pm from Monday to Saturday. It is closed on Sundays and on official government holidays.
Entrance fee to the museum and the libraries is Rs. 25/-.
The Institute is located in beautiful sylvan surroundings and extensive grounds. Close by the main premises of the NIT lies a memorial park in honour of the last king of Sikkim. Amidst the beautiful surroundings stands the bronze statue of Chogyal Palden Thondup Namgyal of Sikkim.

Namgyal Institute of Tibetology, located in Gangtok, Sikkim, is a must-visit for anyone interested in Tibetan culture, history, and Buddhism. The institute houses a fascinating museum with rare artifacts, ancient manuscripts, thangka paintings, and Buddhist relics that provide deep insights into Tibetan heritage. The library is a treasure trove of books on religion, philosophy, and Tibetan studies.

The serene surroundings and traditional Tibetan-style architecture add to its charm, making it a peaceful place for learning and reflection. The institute plays a crucial role in preserving and promoting Tibetan culture.

While the museum is small, it is well-curated, and a visit here can be completed in about an hour. However, photography is not allowed inside. Overall, it's a great place for history buffs, culture enthusiasts, and anyone looking to understand Tibetan Buddhism better.

Pros: Rich collection of artifacts, peaceful ambiance, well-maintained.
Cons: No photography inside, limited exhibit space.

1. Place is located near Ropeway. Taxis need to pay parking charge of Rs 20. Entry ticket is Rs 25/person and can be paid online . No photographs are allowed inside museum.
2. Museum itself is small and contains details of Lord  Buddha's life. If you read everything it will take you half an hour.
3. There's a souvenir shop on the campus but quite costly. You can buy same thing cheaper at MG Road.
4. There's a toilet on the premises. Costs Rs 10 like all toilets in Sikkim.
5. U can visit Do Drul Chorten nearby.
6. Souvenirs shops here mostly accept cash.

reviews.reviewText:
My Visit to Hanuman Tok: A Spiritual Experience

I had the privilege of visiting Hanuman Tok, a revered temple located in the picturesque town of Gangtok, Sikkim. My experience was nothing short of extraordinary, and I felt deeply connected to the divine.

As I climbed the stairs leading to the temple, I felt a sense of serenity wash over me. The temple's serene ambiance, coupled with the stunning natural beauty of the surrounding hills, created a sense of tranquility that was hard to ignore.

The temple itself is a beautiful structure that exudes a sense of peace and calm. The idol of Lord Hanuman, the revered deity, is imposing yet benevolent, and I felt a deep sense of connection to the divine as I offered my prayers.

What struck me most about Hanuman Tok was the sense of community that pervaded the temple premises. Devotees from all walks of life had gathered to offer their prayers, and the sense of camaraderie was palpable.

As I stood there, taking in the breathtaking views of the Himalayas, I felt grateful for the experience. Hanuman Tok is more than just a temple - it's a spiritual haven that offers a sense of peace, calm, and connection to the divine.

If you're planning a trip to Gangtok, I highly recommend a visit to Hanuman Tok. It's an experience that will leave you feeling enriched, renewed, and connected to something greater than yourself.

A very nice and scenic Hanuman temple. A majestic view of Gangtok can be seen from this temple. The place is very clean and well maintained.
It gives you the pleasure of inner peace and calmness. 😍😍😍

My visit to Hanuman Tok in Sikkim was nothing short of magical. As a devoted follower of Lord Hanuman, this place held immense spiritual significance for me. Nestled at an altitude of about 7,200 feet, Hanuman Tok is not just a temple—it’s a peaceful haven that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding Himalayan ranges and a serene atmosphere for inner reflection.
I visited with my friends, and together we spent around two hours there, soaking in the divine energy and scenic beauty. The drive up to the temple was beautiful, with winding roads surrounded by lush greenery and crisp mountain air. Upon reaching, we were greeted by the majestic statue of Lord Hanuman, standing tall and powerful, instilling a deep sense of peace and devotion.
The temple complex is immaculately maintained by the Indian Army, which adds to its charm and sanctity. The panoramic view of Gangtok city from the temple grounds is absolutely stunning, and the quiet environment made it perfect for prayer and meditation. We spent our time exploring the temple, offering prayers, and simply sitting in silence to feel the divine connection.
Being there was an emotional and uplifting experience for me. As a big devotee of Lord Hanuman, I felt truly blessed and spiritually recharged. It was a memorable journey shared with close friends, and Hanuman Tok now holds a special place in my heart. I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking peace, devotion, and natural beauty.

Hanuman tok is dedicated to God Hanuman.The calm and peaceful atmosphere of the temple is a welcome escape from the usual tourist hustle. The place is impeccably clean and well-maintained, thanks to the efforts of the Indian Army. It’s not just a place of worship but also a spot to connect with nature and enjoy the tranquility.

Hanuman Tok is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Gangtok.

During our trip to Gangtok, my friends and I visited the serene Enchey Monastery, a peaceful and spiritually enriching experience nestled amid the hills. The monastery, which belongs to the Nyingma order of Vajrayana Buddhism, exudes a calm atmosphere with its vibrant prayer flags, intricate murals, and the soft hum of chants in the background. Surrounded by lush greenery and offering panoramic views of Gangtok, the location itself feels sacred and removed from the hustle of the town.
The main prayer hall is beautifully adorned with traditional Tibetan Buddhist art and statues, providing a glimpse into the region’s rich spiritual heritage. The monks were respectful and welcoming, allowing us to quietly observe their rituals without intrusion.
Outside the monastery, there were several food stalls and small eateries catering to tourists. While the food options were decent—ranging from local momos and thukpa to more common snacks like noodles and tea—the prices were slightly on the higher side, likely due to the remote location and tourist traffic. However, the taste and freshness of the food made up for the cost to some extent.
Overall, Enchey Monastery is a must-visit spot in Gangtok, especially for those seeking a spiritual retreat or an opportunity to experience Sikkimese culture.
A very nice quiet and serene place. I went with my colleagues and we just loved the place. It has a good cafe and also souvenir shop. A must visit place of Gangtok.

Located in Gangtok, the Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park is one of the few high-altitude zoos in India.

🐾 Wildlife Experience

The zoo is home to several rare and endangered Himalayan species, making it a haven for wildlife enthusiasts and nature lovers.

Key Highlights:
•	Red Panda: The star attraction of the park; if you’re lucky, you might spot one among the trees.
•	Snow Leopard: One of the rarest sights, often spotted in their enclosure at higher altitudes.
•	Himalayan Black Bear, Himalayan Monal, Tibetan Wolf, Goral, and Barking Deer – all adapted to the cold and mountainous terrain.
•	Birdlife: From pheasants to blood pheasants and partridges, birdwatchers will find this park rewarding.

🕒 Time Required
•	The park is extensive and spread out over hilly terrain.
•	Minimum 2–3 hours are required to explore it comfortably, but to fully enjoy the environment, spot animals, take photos, and relax in nature, set aside 4–5 hours.

🌤️ Weather & Atmosphere
•	Cool and Misty throughout the year, especially in the mornings and late afternoons
•	Carry a light jacket or raincoat, as the weather can shift rapidly.

❌ Cons
•	The terrain is steep in places, not ideal for the elderly or those with mobility issues.
•	Wildlife sightings can be sparse depending on weather and time of day.
•	Not easily accessible via public transport – best visited with a taxi or personal vehicle.

placeMetadata.name: Pal Karma Zurmang Shedup Chokhor Ling Lingdum Monastery (Ranka Monastery)

sources.snippet: Located about 20 km from Gangtok, Ranka Monastery also known as Lingdum Monastery is a quaint and beautiful Buddhist monastery in East Sikkim that is a must-visit when you plan any of your Sikkim tour packages. This monastery is built in the traditional Tibetan architectural style and is well-known for its bright symbolic frescoes, intricate hand paintings, Thankas and the high-spirited exotic Lama Mask dance that is performed by the monks before the Losar festival. The monastery serves as a learning base for young lamas who undergo training to become full-fledged monks, learn about the ways of Buddhism and also participate in activities that help maintain the upkeep of the monastery.
sources.shortName: Tourist Attractions - Best Places to Visit in Gangtok,Sikkim

Nestled amidst lush green hills, it offers a peaceful atmosphere for meditation and panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

Also known as Ranka Monastery, it is a haven of serenity and spiritual significance. Located in the Ranka village of East Sikkim district, this ancient monastery holds a special place in the hearts of both pilgrims and travellers alike. With its rich history, unique architecture, and awe-inspiring surroundings, this Monastery is a must-visit destination that offers a glimpse into the spiritual and cultural fabric of the region.
It is home to over one hundred monks who study and practice Tibetan Buddhism. The monastery also has a rich collection of Buddhist art and artifacts, including murals, sculptures, and thangkas.
The monastery is open to visitors and is a popular tourist destination. Visitors can explore the monastery complex, learn about Tibetan Buddhism, and enjoy the stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys.

reviews.reviewText: One of the best falls I have been to yet. Ban Jhakri Waterfall is a serene and refreshing spot near Gangtok, perfect for nature lovers and families. Surrounded by lush greenery and traditional sculptures, the area offers a peaceful escape with a cultural touch. The sound of cascading water adds to its charm. Well-maintained paths and small bridges enhance the experience. It’s an ideal place for photography, relaxation, and learning about local legends. A must-visit for anyone exploring Sikkim.

My Memorable Visit to Ban Jhakri Waterfall, Gangtok
During my recent trip to Gangtok, one of the most memorable experiences was visiting the Ban Jhakri Waterfall. Tucked away in a beautifully forested area, this place felt like a slice of peace and power combined. As soon as I entered, I could hear the distant roar of the waterfall—it instantly made me excited.
The entry fee is ₹50 per person, which I found very affordable for what the place offers. There's also parking available right near the entrance—convenient and spacious. The exact parking fee might depend on the vehicle, but it was reasonably priced i e ₹20-50
Before even entering the main waterfall area, there are several small shops and food stalls. I found some really good local snacks and souvenirs here, which added to the experience. It's perfect if you're looking to grab a bite or shop a little before heading in. Inside, the area is very well maintained. There are man-made walkways, charming bridges, and statues representing Sikkimese shamanic traditions—which made the place both cultural and educational. The waterfall itself was absolutely breathtaking. Standing near it, feeling the mist on my face, was so refreshing. It’s also a great photo spot, with greenery all around and the powerful water cascading down. Overall, I had a fantastic time at Ban Jhakri Waterfall. It’s a perfect mix of nature, culture, and relaxation—ideal for families, couples, or solo travelers. I’d definitely recommend including it in your Gangtok itinerary.

reviews.reviewText: Nestled on a serene hill, this monastery is a haven of peace and spirituality. As we stepped inside, the air resonated with the deep, rhythmic chanting of monks, their voices weaving a tranquil mantra that instantly calmed the soul. Among them were young novice monks, their presence adding a touching innocence to the sacred atmosphere. The spacious premises, surprisingly expansive for a hilltop setting, exuded warmth and harmony, inviting visitors to linger and reflect.The view from the monastery was breathtaking, with rolling landscapes stretching far below, offering a perfect backdrop for contemplation. A massive flag stood proudly at the center of the courtyard, fluttering gently in the breeze, symbolizing resilience and unity. The architecture blended simplicity with grandeur, creating an environment that felt both humble and awe-inspiring.Spending time here was rejuvenating—whether meditating, strolling the grounds, or simply soaking in the serene vibes. The monastery’s blend of natural beauty, spiritual depth, and welcoming energy makes it a must-visit for anyone seeking solace or inspiration. It’s a place where time slows down, and the heart finds peace. Highly recommended for a soulful retreat.

Last month, we visited Gonjang Monastery with family, and it was an unforgettable experience. Situated atop a hill, the monastery offers breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains, a serene river, and a picturesque village along its banks. The natural beauty surrounding the monastery adds to its charm, making it a perfect retreat from the hustle of daily life.

What struck us most was the tranquility of the place. The peaceful environment allowed us to reflect and connect with the serene lifestyle of the monks. It was insightful to witness their way of life, devotion, and simplicity, which left us with a sense of calm and inspiration.

The monastery itself is architecturally stunning, with intricate designs and a sacred ambiance. Visiting Gonjang Monastery was a soulful experience, and we left feeling more connected to nature and spirituality. It’s a must-visit destination for peace seekers.

A truly enriching experience and a place that leaves lasting memories.

Gonjang Monastery is located at Fatak Bojhogari near Tashi Viewpoint in Gangtok, Sikkim, around 8 kilometres from Gangtok. It is one of Gangtok’s most famous monasteries and one of the top Gangtok attractions, with an elevation of 6066 feet.

Gonjang Monastery is a serene haven nestled in the hills of Gangtok, offering stunning mountain views and rich spiritual ambiance. Its vibrant murals and peaceful surroundings reflect deep religious significance. A perfect blend of beauty and devotion, it’s an inspiring place for meditation, learning, and cultural exploration.

A peaceful haven with breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. The expansive grounds are adorned with a massive flag at the center of the courtyard, fluttering gently in the breeze, symbolizing resilience and unity. The architecture blends simplicity with grandeur, creating an environment that feels both humble and awe-inspiring.

The atmosphere is tranquil, with the rhythmic chanting of monks resonating throughout, offering a meditative experience for visitors. The monastery also houses beautifully painted murals and intricate statues that reflect the rich heritage of Tibetan Buddhism. These artistic elements provide insight into ancient traditions and teachings, making the visit both educational and spiritually uplifting.

Best Time to Visit: The monastery is open daily from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. It's recommended to visit between 1:00 PM and 4:00 PM to enjoy the views before the evening chill sets in.

Photography: Photography is permitted in the outer areas, but not inside the main hall to respect the sanctity of the space.

Accessibility: Located approximately 8 km from Gangtok SNT Bus Station, it's best accessed by taxi, private vehicle, or rental bike. The monastery is also close to Tashi Viewpoint, making it convenient to visit both in a single trip.

Overall, Gonjang Monastery is an ideal place for those seeking peace, culture, and panoramic natural beauty all in one spot.

placeMetadata.name: Gangtok Ropeway

sources.snippet: The Gangtok Cable Car, also known as the Ropeway, is one of the top attractions in Gangtok, Sikkim. It offers visitors a thrilling ride with breathtaking views of the city, surrounding hills, and the snow-capped peaks of the Himalayas. The cable car ride stretches about 1 kilometer and has three main stops: Deorali Bazaar, Namnang, and Tashiling.
sources.shortName: Gangtok tourist places | Gangtok images MAP

sources.snippet: The real beauty of the Gangtok trip can be experienced only when you are flying in the sky. But of course, humans can’t and that is where the ropeway kicks in. These cable cars link Deorali Bazaar with Tashiling Secretariat and offer a panoramic view of mountains & the city.

As you ascend, you'll be treated to breathtaking panoramas that include lush green valleys and the majestic Kanchenjunga range. reviews.reviewText:
The cable cars were clean and well maintained and the ride felt safe and smooth throughout.
The ride offers a breathtaking panoramic view of the entire city. On a clear day, you can even catch a glimpse of the distant snow capped peaks.

The Gangtok Ropeway is a must-try experience in the heart of Sikkim! The ride offers stunning aerial views of Gangtok city, lush valleys, and on a clear day, even glimpses of the majestic Kanchenjunga. It's a short but memorable 15–20 minute round trip, connecting three stations with spacious cable cars. The experience is peaceful and perfect for both families and solo travelers. Go early to avoid long queues and don’t forget your camera—every moment is photo-worthy! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Gangtok.

Took the Gangtok ropeway with my husband—thought it’d be a peaceful ride, but they packed us in like it was a sky-high local train! 😅 The price was on the higher side too. We could barely move or click pictures properly. But once we looked out… wow! The view was absolutely amazing and totally worth all the chaos.

Gangtok is beautiful in the sense that people generations past and currently as well, have developed an efficient system of hairpin curves along which resorts, shops and houses are constructed with breathtaking alignment and aesthetics. It's a view to behold from a cable car, and so it's an opportunity indeed. However the path chosen is rather too far from the view that you'd probably need a professional camera to capture the beauty that extends till the curtain of fog.

It seemed like locals actually use this ropeway as a part of their daily commute. There was even a monthly pass option, while I just took a one way ride.

The boarding process is a bit unusual. everyone waits at ground level first, then again at the ropeway station.

But the view from up here is absolutely stunning. Riding slowly uphill along the steep slopes of Gangtok, Can enjoy a unique view of the busy streets and lush green forests. A beautiful experience.

Tried the Gangtok Ropeway during my trip, and it was a fun and scenic experience! As a tourist, this is a great way to get a bird’s-eye view of the city and the surrounding hills. The ride isn’t very long (about 10–15 minutes round trip), but the views are totally worth it — you get to see Gangtok town, the flowing river below, and on a clear day, even the snow-covered peaks in the distance.

The ropeway has three stations, but most people do the round trip from the middle station. It does get a bit crowded, especially in peak season, so be prepared for a short wait. The cabins can feel a bit cramped, but the overall ride is smooth and safe.

Ticket prices are reasonable, and it’s a great photo opportunity. I’d recommend going around late afternoon — the light is perfect and the city looks beautiful from above.

A nice, quick addition to your Gangtok sightseeing list!

Too many people in a single mountain cable car ride. It looks like you are in Mumbai local train during rush hour.....Ropeway operators should take few people in a ride, so that the actual feel of the ropeway ride can be experienced or if possible to them, the other way is to have small 3-4 cars on a single rope. With these small cars the total passenger capacity will be the same as that of in a big car and the load on the rope will be the same. Switching the side while returning so that we will get other side view is not a good option. Though the views are better seen from mountain cable car, but you can't get 360 degree view in a car as it is totally packed with people. You will get only one side view. This is disappointing as a tourist.

reviews.reviewText:
Bakthang Waterfall is a delightful natural spot just a short drive from Gangtok, located along the North Sikkim Highway near Tashi View Point. The waterfall, though not very tall, is quite wide and cascades gracefully over rocks surrounded by lush greenery, creating a serene and picturesque setting.

The area is well-maintained, with amenities like parking, souvenir shops, and a small café nearby, making it a pleasant stop for travelers. For those seeking a bit of adventure, there's a zip-lining activity available for ₹100 per person, offering a unique perspective of the waterfall and its surroundings.

A hidden beauty in the heart of Gangtok! Bakthang Waterfall is a peaceful and scenic spot, surrounded by lush greenery and natural beauty. The waterfall itself is not too large but offers a serene atmosphere and crystal-clear water cascading down the rocks. It’s a short and easy trek to reach the waterfall, making it accessible to most visitors. The surroundings are perfect for photography and relaxing by the water. A great stop for nature lovers looking to enjoy a quiet moment away from the hustle of the city!

Well I didn’t stop to have a look, however it felt like a vibrant place for sure. It’s a nice place and one can click decent photos. It has a “ I ♥️BRO”(Border Road Organisation) structure as well, which definitely looks like a tourist attraction. However, when it comes to waterfalls I think there a places that a definitely better than this and I wouldn’t recommend anyone to solely visit this place. If it’s coming on the way to somewhere then surely have a look and enjoy the place. 😇

A short 10-minute drive from Gangtok, Bakthang Falls offers a quick nature escape. The waterfall isn't massive but makes up for it with its cool mountain freshness and photogenic cascades. The viewing area is well-maintained with railings for safety, though the steps can get slippery.

Good for: A 30-minute stop to stretch your legs, enjoy the mist, and snap some pictures. Best visited en route to other attractions

Bakthang Waterfall makes for a charming and leisurely side‑trip from Gangtok—a refreshing stop full of natural beauty without demanding time or effort. Its combination of greenery, easy access, small adventure, and local flavor makes it ideal for a brief scenic break. It can be skipped, not so great.

Tucked away just a few kilometers from the chaos (read: charm) of Gangtok, the Bakthang Waterfall* is like that soft-spoken friend at a party who doesn’t say much… but steals the spotlight anyway. Unlike the thundering drama of its flashier cousin Ban Jhakri, Bakthang whispers its way down a mossy cliff, offering serenity with a splash and a side of misty magic.

First Things First – Where Are We?
Located along the North Sikkim Highway, a breezy 3–4 km from Gangtok city center, Bakthang is often the first stop on the North Sikkim tour circuit. And trust me, it's a stellar opening act. The name "Bakthang" comes from the Lepcha words: "Bak" (forest) and "Thang" (field) – so yes, it’s literally a field of forest, and it looks every bit as enchanting.

The Scene – Water, Weaves, and Wow!
The waterfall, while not towering in height, is wide and graceful – think chiffon saree in a wind tunnel. Cascading down a rocky wall blanketed with ferns, it lands in a shallow basin, perfect for a quick foot dip or an impromptu dance number (yes, people *do* that).

Local adventure lovers also run a zipline across the face of the falls. If you’ve ever wanted to channel your inner Tarzan with a GoPro, this is your moment.

And guess what? Right near the falls, locals offer traditional Sikkimese attire photoshoots. Get dressed like royalty from the mountains and click pics with the falls as your royal backdrop – 100% filmy, 200% fun.

Fun-Sized Facts:
- Bakthang is fed by the Ratey Chu river, which also supplies water to much of Gangtok.
- The waterfall is not too crowded, which makes it perfect for those looking to dodge touristy chaos.
- It’s accessible even for senior citizens or folks who don’t want to trek a mile just to see a splash.

My Personal Verdict:
Bakthang isn’t about grandeur. It’s about grace. A serene, postcard-worthy pitstop that offers a mix of culture, calm, and quirky photo-ops.

Wonderful Experience at Hotel Mayfair Gangtok!

We stayed at Hotel Mayfair Gangtok on 30th April and had a truly amazing experience. The property is stunning—peaceful, beautifully maintained, and full of charm. But what truly made our stay special was the incredible hospitality of the staff.

After we checked out, I realized I had forgotten one of my shoes in the room. I called the hotel, and they responded immediately. To my surprise, they had found it and promptly couriered it to me, perfectly packed. I received it today, and they didn’t even ask for any extra payment for the courier. That level of care and service is rare!

Thank you, Mayfair team, for your warmth, professionalism, and thoughtful gesture. Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Gangtok!

A Mixed Experience at a Promising Property

As a seasoned traveler with a keen eye for detail and service quality, I recently stayed at this luxury hotel near Gangtok. While the property shows significant potential in terms of infrastructure and location, several service-related issues made the experience less than ideal. Below is a detailed breakdown for fellow travelers considering this hotel.

⸻

Pros:

1. Room Quality:
The rooms were exceptional — spacious, spotlessly clean, and elegantly furnished. The bed was comfortable, and the in-room amenities reflected the standards expected of a premium property. Housekeeping was consistent and professional throughout the stay.

2. Location:
The hotel is located approximately 10 kilometers from Gangtok city, which may not be ideal for those seeking close proximity to the town center. However, the location itself is peaceful, scenic, and secure — offering a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle.

3. Food (Buffet Options):
The buffet spread was extensive and well-curated with multiple choices catering to varied tastes. The quality and taste of the food met expectations for a luxury stay, and special mention goes to the live counters and local dishes on offer.

4. Amenities:
The property features a well-maintained swimming pool and a relaxing spa, both of which enhanced the stay. Facilities were clean and met the expectations of a high-end resort.

⸻

Cons:

1. Service & Staff Behaviour:
Unfortunately, the most disappointing aspect of the stay was the service, particularly at the reception. The staff were unprofessional and inconsistent — with different personnel providing conflicting information about check-in procedures and hotel policies. Requests were met with indifference, and responsiveness was severely lacking. For a luxury hotel, such lapses in guest service are unacceptable and reflect poorly on management.

2. Buffet Service Staff:
While the food itself was impressive, the service at the buffet was chaotic and inattentive. Repeated requests to refill empty buffet items were ignored. The lack of proactive service was frustrating, especially during peak meal times. Only one staff member, Govardhan, stood out for his courteous and efficient attitude — the rest of the team appeared disengaged and indifferent.

3. Value for Money:
In terms of infrastructure, room quality, and amenities, the hotel does justify its price point. However, when factoring in the poor staff behavior and lack of responsive service, the overall value proposition diminishes significantly. A luxury property must consistently deliver on service to justify premium rates — something this hotel currently fails to do.

⸻

Final Verdict:

This property holds strong potential with its elegant rooms, tranquil location, and good food. However, the lack of professional, guest-oriented service significantly mars the overall experience. For travelers prioritizing comfort and amenities, it may still be a viable choice — but those who value consistent and courteous service may find themselves disappointed.

Taste of Tibet is a small yet popular restaurant tucked away on the first floor along the bustling MG Marg in Gangtok. Known for its Tibetan specialties like momos, shyaphale, and thukpa (or thumpa), it’s a cozy spot that draws both tourists and locals.

We tried a few of their signature dishes. The momos were decent but didn’t quite live up to the hype — they lacked the punch of flavor we were expecting. However, the thumpa completely won us over with its rich and comforting taste — perfect for the chilly weather. The shyaphale was another highlight: crispy and well-fried on the outside with a generous, flavorful chicken stuffing inside.

Overall, Taste of Tibet is a good place to stop by if you’re exploring MG Marg and craving some Tibetan comfort food. It's definitely worth a visit for the thumpa and shyaphale!

The atmosphere of the restaurant was casual and lively. It’s located right on the main MG Road, so it’s always buzzing with people. Inside, the place had a simple, no-fuss setup but felt warm and welcoming. It had that local, authentic feel which made the eating experience even better. Service was quick, and the staff were polite, even during the busy hours.

Definitely a great spot to enjoy some tasty Tibetan-style food while soaking in the local vibe of Gangtok.

Erected in 1932, this two-story structure is an exquisite example of colonial architecture that transports visitors back to a bygone era. The hall not only serves as a historical landmark but also functions as a vibrant cultural center where local art and crafts are celebrated through various events and exhibitions.

reviews.reviewText: Tsuklakhang Palace or Tsuklakhang Royal Chapel and Monastery is a Buddhist palatial monastery in Gangtok, Sikkim, India. Tsuklakhang Palace and its Royal History. King Thutob Namgyal and his queen Yeshe Dolma were the first residents of this palace. Dolma was born to an elite family in Tibet and became the second queen when the king Thutob remarried in 1882 after his first wife passed away. Their marriage took place in Lhasa of Tibet.

My recent stay at VSTM Bamboo Grove Retreat was a delightful experience from start to finish. The tranquil setting surrounded by lush bamboo trees provided a sense of tranquility that is hard to find elsewhere. The variety of accommodation options, including the city hotel and lodge, catered to diverse preferences, ensuring there's something for everyone. The attentive staff made me feel welcomed and valued throughout my stay, and the amenities provided were top-notch. I left feeling rejuvenated and refreshed, already planning my next visit to this oasis of calm.

A hidden gem nestled within the city, VSTM Bamboo Grove Retreat surpassed all my expectations. The blend of modern amenities with the serene ambiance of a B&B made my stay truly unforgettable. The attention to detail in every aspect of the retreat, from the meticulously clean rooms to the delicious breakfast offerings, was evident. Whether you're traveling for business or leisure, this retreat provides the perfect sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I can't wait to return!

I recently had the misfortune of staying at Bamboo grove Retreat, and I must say it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. From the moment we checked in until the time we left, our stay was marred by the poor construction of the hotel, particularly on the second floor where our room was located.

The entire hotel is built with flimsy structures, which becomes abundantly clear once you step foot on the second floor. The moment someone walks on the third floor, it feels as if the entire ceiling is about to collapse. The incessant shaking and creaking of the floor above made it impossible to relax or get a good night's sleep. I felt like I was constantly on edge, fearing that the whole floor might come crashing down at any moment.

Not only did the shaky construction make our stay incredibly uncomfortable, but it also affected the overall ambiance of the hotel. The constant noise from the creaking floors and walls created a distracting and unpleasant atmosphere, disrupting any chance of tranquility or relaxation. It was impossible to escape the feeling that the hotel was simply not safe or structurally sound.

Additionally, the management's response to our concerns was less than satisfactory. When we brought up the issue of the shaky construction, the staff seemed dismissive and uninterested in addressing our complaints. It felt as if they were aware of the problem but had no intention of rectifying it. Such indifference and lack of concern for guest satisfaction is simply unacceptable.

Moreover, the problems with the construction were not limited to the noise and instability. The room itself had various issues, including outdated furnishings, uncomfortable beds, and a lack of basic amenities. The cleanliness of the room was also questionable, with stains on the carpet and a musty odor that lingered throughout our stay.

Overall, my experience at Bamboo Retreat was incredibly disappointing. The poorly constructed wooden building, especially on the second floor, made for an uncomfortable and nerve-wracking stay. The lackluster response from the management and the overall subpar condition of the room only added to our dissatisfaction. I would strongly advise against staying at this hotel unless you enjoy sleepless nights and a constant sense of unease.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the VSTM Bamboo Grove hotel and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. The hotel's service, location, and room quality surpassed all my expectations.

First and foremost, the hotel's location near MG MARG was perfect. It was conveniently situated in the heart of the city, making it easy for me to explore the local attractions, restaurants, and shops. I didn't have to travel far to experience the vibrant energy of the area.

The room at VSTM Bamboo Grove was exceptionally clean and spacious. The attention to detail in maintaining cleanliness was evident throughout my stay. The room was tastefully decorated and provided ample space for relaxation and comfort.

But what truly made my stay memorable was the remarkable service provided by the hotel staff, especially Tanmay da, Pritam da, and the rest of the team. Their warm and friendly demeanor made me feel welcome from the moment I stepped into the hotel. They were always available to assist with any requests or inquiries I had, going above and beyond to ensure my stay was enjoyable.

Their professionalism and genuine care for the guests were evident in every interaction. Their recommendations for local attractions and dining options were spot-on, allowing me to make the most of my time in the city.

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a memorable and comfortable stay in Gangtok.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Porky's Restaurant, located in Deorali, is a well-known establishment offering continental cuisine alongside Indian and Chinese dishes. With a classic ambiance reminiscent of the British colonial era, this restaurant has been serving its patrons for many years. The menu features the famous 'Porky's Mix Grilled Sizzler' and handmade noodles, which are highly recommended by visitors.
placeMetadata.address: Deorali Bazar, Gangtok, Sikkim 737102, India

reviews.reviewText: Porky’s Restaurant in New Castle offers a warm, welcoming ambiance that makes it an enjoyable spot for a casual outing. We stopped in for coffee and snacks, and the experience was pleasant with friendly staff and prompt service. The coffee was fresh, and the snacks were satisfying, making it a great place to relax and enjoy a light bite. The decor added a cozy charm, enhancing the overall feel of the place. Perfect for a quick break or catching up with friends.

happy to see that porky’s has upgraded their menu since last two years. customer service and music playlist could use some work. the chef had prepared my smoothie but the sweetness level was 100 so i couldn’t take second sip.

It is one of the oldest restaurant in Gangtok offering continental cuisine besides the standard Indian and Chinese fare.The restaurant is spacious and the walls are done up in wood panelling lending it an old world British era feel (Think Glenarys Darjeeling!).
The food is just okay not good not bad and price average given the ambience and views.
We tried the Chicken Sizzler which was actually sizzling hot, served with a side of the softest buttered bread. We also had Pork Momos  which was really good but took a long time coming since they said they make it fresh to order. We wanted a second plate but would have to wait again. The momos  unlike other pork momos  in Gangtok are thin skinned with less fat slivers and more or red mince meat which was to my liking.
Of course the hot momo chutney and broth was there as accompaniment.
The fresh lime soda was soothing and was beautifully decorated but the beer we ordered was room temperature even though we had asked for a chilled one. The waiter just opened it without letting us check the same!
The window seats offer a beautiful breezy view of the Ranka area but the seats further inside could get stuffy as there was no fan and we had visited on a humid July afternoon.

The service is a tad slow but the staff generally polite and courteous. Overall a fair to good experience dining here though I wouldn't visit it again. It is located in Deorali a lot further from the city centre so unless you have some work there or have come specifically to eat at Porky's it seems a bit out of the way.
Also parking would be an issue here so its recommended to take a shared taxi.

Pork's Restaurant offers a delightful culinary experience with its diverse menu and cozy ambiance. From succulent pork dishes to flavorful vegetarian options, there's something to please every palate. The attentive service adds to the overall dining experience. However, the restaurant's pricing may be on the higher side for some. Nonetheless, Pork's is a must-visit for food enthusiasts looking to indulge in delicious fare in a welcoming atmosphere. The sizzler is a must try!!!

Upon entering, I was immediately captivated by the elegant ambiance, with soft lighting and tasteful decor creating an inviting atmosphere. The warm welcome from the staff further enhanced the dining experience, setting the tone for what was to come.
Title: A Sizzling Sensation: Porky's Delivers Culinary Excellence with Sizzler Plates

What sets Porky's apart is their innovative approach to traditional dishes, and their sizzler plates are a prime example of this culinary creativity. The moment a sizzler plate is brought to your table, the aroma alone is enough to tantalize your taste buds. The sight of the dish sizzling away, accompanied by the sound of the savory juices bubbling, creates an anticipation that is unmatched.

In conclusion, Porky's sizzler plates are a must-try for anyone looking to indulge in a culinary sensation. From the sizzle of the plate to the explosion of flavors, each bite is a journey of culinary delight. Whether you're a meat lover, seafood aficionado, or vegetarian enthusiast, Porky's has a sizzler plate that will leave you craving more. Highly recommended for a sizzling good time.

A really old and perhaps the first restuarant in Sikkim to introduce continental cuisine. This restaurant has been around for a long long time and to this day, hasn't changed much. It has much to offer like the all time classic 'Porky's Mix Grilled Sizzler'. The taste is out of this world and unlike anything you've ever tasted before. Also, they have a bakery and serve handmade noodles.
The service is great and so is the ambience. I have so many memories here right from my childhood. Would strongly recommend!

One of the old and famous restaurants in Gangtok. I come there every time when I visit Gangtok for last decade or more. Nice cozy ambiance with wooden decor, retro feel and most importantly food is great. I will highly recommend the sizzler here.

reviews.reviewText: The stay at Demazong was absolutely fantastic. The staff were very helpful and kind. Our stay for two days here was amazing. The facilities provided were also excellent. Also the seating in the dining area can be improved because when we went there were many guests and not enough seating.Apart from that our stay was absolutely wonderful .

### Shayar Sikkimese Guest House: A Cozy Hideaway in Gangtok

During my visit to Gangtok in 2022, I had the pleasure of staying at the Shayar Sikkimese Guest House. This charming guest house, tucked away in an unconventional location, offers a delightful combination of comfortable rooms, excellent staff behavior, and a unique, tranquil setting.

#### Location
Shayar Sikkimese Guest House is situated a bit off the beaten path, requiring a brief walk from the main road. While the location may seem a bit unusual, it contributes to the guest house’s peaceful ambiance, away from the hustle and bustle of the city center. The guest house is perched on a hillside, offering stunning views of the surrounding valleys and mountains. This slightly remote location is ideal for those seeking a serene retreat amidst nature.

#### Rooms
The rooms at Shayar Sikkimese Guest House are well-appointed and cozy, providing a perfect blend of comfort and local charm. Each room is tastefully decorated with traditional Sikkimese elements, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms are clean and equipped with modern amenities. Despite being a guest house, the quality of the rooms rivals that of many higher-end accommodations.

#### Staff Behavior
One of the most commendable aspects of Shayar Sikkimese Guest House is the behavior of the staff. From the moment I arrived, the staff members were exceptionally welcoming and attentive. They were always ready to assist with any requests, whether it was arranging transportation, offering local recommendations, or ensuring that my stay was comfortable. Their genuine hospitality and friendly demeanor made my experience truly enjoyable.

#### Amenities
While Shayar Sikkimese Guest House does not offer a wide range of luxury amenities, it provides everything necessary for a comfortable stay. The guest house has a small dining area where guests can enjoy home-cooked Sikkimese meals, which were delicious and reasonably priced. The complimentary breakfast, featuring local dishes, was a highlight of my mornings. Additionally, the guest house offers free Wi-Fi, which was reliable during my stay.

#### Overall Experience
Shayar Sikkimese Guest House is a hidden gem in Gangtok, offering excellent value for money. Its slightly offbeat location adds to the charm, providing a peaceful and scenic environment. The combination of well-maintained rooms, exceptional staff behavior, and a tranquil setting makes it an ideal choice for travelers seeking a cozy and affordable stay in Gangtok.

In conclusion, Shayar Sikkimese Guest House stands out for its warm hospitality, comfortable accommodations, and unique location. If you’re looking for a quiet and charming place to stay in Gangtok, away from the usual tourist spots, Shayar Sikkimese Guest House is definitely worth considering.

reviews.reviewText: It was a wonderful stay . From the moment we arrived we were greeted with warmth. The front desk team was efficient & friendly . Each interaction with the staff demonstrated their dedication to make our stay truly enjoyable. …

This hotel was a profoundly disappointing experience. Our room was plagued by an unbearable foul odor, likely from a "mat potty." Room - i was travelling wid my baby n inlaws so i hd to be sure that the room is good n clean they send me photos of the room which i booked but when i reached der we got the most disgusting rum with no proper lights bathrum lock was broken water tape broken .so i complained for another rum but they said no room available n gave us the option for suite n a family room with extra money
2 hospitality - this is more than worst when i start complaining about the room they started showing der true colors after changing the room i called for water n food but instead they dont pick up n after 3 times calling they say we should order everything at 1time because our room was on top floor let me tell u there is lift after that also they talked rudely n dont pick up call
Plz dont book this hotel or u will suffer if u complain my trip got spoilt because of this hotel

Deeply Disappointing Stay - Avoid This Hotel!
Our recent experience at this hotel was profoundly disappointing and fell far short of any reasonable expectation, let alone a 3-star rating. From the moment we entered our assigned room, we were met with an unbearable and pervasive foul odor, seemingly originating from a "mat potty" present in the room. This stench permeated the entire floor and made our stay immediately unpleasant.
Beyond the overwhelming smell, the general condition of the room was appalling. Everything felt old, worn, and neglected. The bedsheets and pillows were visibly dirty, raising serious hygiene concerns and making us question the overall cleanliness of the establishment. Adding to the misery, there was active leakage on the room wall, a clear indication of significant disrepair and lack of maintenance.
The issues didn't end with the room. The food served was unhygienic and of very low quality, further compounding our negative experience.
Based on the unacceptable state of our room, the pervasive odors, the lack of cleanliness, and the poor quality of the food, we can unequivocally say that this hotel does not meet the standards of a 3-star establishment. Our stay was truly unpleasant, and we would strongly advise others to avoid this hotel to prevent a similarly disappointing experience.

This place feels like an authentic hotel. The rooms are designed beautifully. The view is amazing! The balcony has insta-worthy frames. I would love to visit this place again. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean. The staff is friendly and polite. Thank you for the wonderful experience!

DO NOT STAY at Hotel Snow Lion, Gangtok. This was the most disgusting and disturbing hotel experience I’ve ever had.

The room was in a horrifying condition – filthy bedsheets, foul smell, spider webs all over the walls and ceiling, and to top it off, actual human potty on the bathroom door mat. That’s not just dirty, that’s inhumane. It’s clear they do not clean or even inspect the rooms before handing them over.

The bathroom was moldy and stinking, clearly untouched for days. The food was just as bad – unhygienic, tasteless, and made me feel sick. Nothing about this hotel is safe or comfortable. The staff was rude and completely unbothered when we complained.

This is not a hotel – it’s a health hazard. Staying here was a huge mistake. If you value your health and peace of mind, stay far away from this place. I genuinely believe this hotel should be shut down by authorities.

sources.snippet: Another extremely beautiful place to stay with scenic views and a quiet, serene ambiance is The Shire (9647872371), which is located in Arithang. Rooms begin at Rs 1500 a night.
sources.shortName: Gangtok Tourism | Gangtok Tourist Places | Gangtok Travel Guide | Gangtok Weather | Gangtok Photos

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the serene hills of Arithang, The Shire offers a delightful escape that feels just like home. This charming homestay boasts spacious rooms with incredibly comfortable beds, ensuring you enjoy restful nights during your vacation. With free parking available, it's an ideal spot for those exploring the sights of Gangtok. Guests rave about the warm hospitality provided by Mr. Karma and his family, who go above and beyond to make you feel like part of their extended family.
placeMetadata.address: Tshugshing House, Rashmi Prasad Alley Marg, below A.I.R qtrs, Arithang, Gangtok, Sikkim 737101, India

reviews.reviewText:
I have recently stayed in The Shire, Gangtok. This is definitely one of the best homestays I have ever stayed . The Rooms are pretty big with all the facilities of a decent hotel. The hospitality and behavior of Mr. Karma and his family will definitely make them your extended family. The breakfast is a great combination of British and Indian foods. The dinner items were awesome. Both my sons and me liked the taste of their food.
The location is very near to M.G. Marg, yet very quiet and peaceful. The view from the extended rooftop garden is great .
This is a must stay if you are coming to Gangtok with your family and prefer a nice and peaceful stay.
Thank you Mr. Karma and Aunty for your great hospitality and memorable stay for us.

Review of The Shire, Gangtok

My recent stay along with my family at The Shire in Gangtok was a truly delightful experience, just as was described by Mansoor of Wild and Beyond, primarily due to their exceptional hospitality and the genuine warmth extended to guests. From the moment we arrived, we felt less like hotel guests and more like welcomed visitors in a family home.

Closeness Towards Guests: The hosts at The Shire, particularly Karma and his family, are consistently praised for their friendly and helpful nature. They go above and beyond to ensure guests feel comfortable and at home. The personal touch and willingness to engage with guests truly stood out. For instance, though the meals were not included in the stay, Karma and his mother communicated to ask whether we required meals from time to time, and also though there was less parking place available, Karma gladly accomodated our Isuzu MUX.  The height in embracing the guests with personal touch was that Karma and his family kept the same room we check in on first day available for us while we returned, kept our excessive luggage and car fridge with them until we returned and also gladly accepted our request to reshuffle return arrival days which happened because of bad climatic conditions in North Sikkim.

Services: The services provided were commendable. The rooms are generally described as clean and cozy, with daily housekeeping ensuring a comfortable stay and are well-maintained and equipped with necessary amenities like electric kettles etc. The availability of free Wi-Fi was also a plus. We enjoyed the delicious and wholesome food served even Sikkimese Cuisine at times, often featuring local flavors.  We particularly enjoyed the breakfast, which offered a good mix of options.

Surroundings: We experienced The Shire as a green and peaceful oasis where one can enjoy gardens with blooming flowers and the sight of butterflies with home created garden.

In summary, The Shire offers a peaceful retreat with a strong emphasis on making guests feel welcome and importantly cared for. If you value genuine hospitality and a personal touch during your travels away from hustle and bustle  of city life, The Shire in Gangtok is an excellent choice.

We had a wonderful stay at the Shire.
The rooms are cozy and the vibe is very calm and peaceful. It has a beautiful garden with good views and brightens up the mornings.
They also provide some authentic wholesome home cooked meals and the service is excellent.
It is at around 15 mins walking distance from mg road but the walk is quite steep. However there are shared taxis available if needed and you could enquire about the same.

A Perfect Home Away From Home

I had a truly wonderful stay at this homestay! The hosts were incredibly warm, welcoming, and attentive to every detail, making me feel right at home from the moment I arrived. The room was clean, cozy, and thoughtfully decorated, with all the amenities I needed for a comfortable stay.

The highlight was definitely the beautifully maintained garden filled with vibrant flowers — it created such a peaceful and refreshing atmosphere. The surroundings were calm and scenic, perfect for relaxing and enjoying nature.

Aunty’s home-cooked food was absolutely delicious — made with love and care, just like how a family would cook for you. Every meal felt comforting and reminded me of home. The hosts treated me like one of their own, always making sure I was comfortable and well taken care of.

If you’re looking for a quiet, cozy place with beautiful surroundings and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, this is the perfect homestay. I’ll definitely come back again!

We stayed at the Shire for 4 nights last week and it was a great experience. The rooms where clean and the food was delicious- veg, non- veg and local cuisine. They have a lovely garden open to sky with a view of Gangtok city. The host and his mother did everything to make our stay memorable and the conversations around their culture, traditions and lifestyle were interesting. A must visit homestay if you want to experience hospitality at its best.

We stayed there for 2days and must say that’s a best Homestay in Gangtok, you can enjoy the Mountain View, garden n it’s very close to MG marg. The room was spotless, the decor was enjoyable, and the beds were quite comfortable. Karma and his family are very gracious hosts and we enjoyed our conversations with them☺️☺️

I stayed there for 2 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. It's a quiet place situated in a beautiful garden. Even though the room is rather small it's spotlessly clean and there is everything you need.
And the owner is very friendly and helpful.

I was amazed by the beauty of this homestay. You not only experience the simplicity of the local hospitality but also get to see the richness of Sikkimese lifestyle. The look and feel of this homestay is as good as any 5 star hotel, mostly because of the opulent furniture, cutlery, paintings and the plants. We paid a reasonable amount for all this and the owner was kind enough to accommodate us in the deluxe room despite the standard room booking. (PS - it may not happen during peak season) we had a beautiful view from our room and the icing on the cake was the K2 view right from their lawn!! They serve very good English breakfast at affordable prices. The only thing  we felt was the dinner could have been of little less cost. One thing to be noted, they serve simple and tasty organic meals and be very mindful to eat light as it will keep you going in your hectic drives to north sikkim. Last point, the location is little down in Arithang area of Gangtok, so that may bother you unless you are a fitness freak like me :) I absolutely loved my stay here, the family is doing an amazing job at maintaining this place 😊 save sometime for this peaceful homestay tucked in a cozy corner of Gangtok. They have a nice.lobby with a mini library. You can't get enough of this place!! Thank you for my wonderful time here 😊😊😊

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Nestled in the eastern Himalayas, Gangtok is a vibrant city that offers breathtaking views and a rich tapestry of culture. With the majestic Kanchenjunga mountain range as its backdrop, this charming destination is a photographer's dream. From the stunning vistas at Tashi View Point to the serene ambiance of the Enchey Monastery, every corner of Gangtok presents an opportunity to capture the beauty of nature and the essence of Tibetan culture. Whether you're wandering through the colorful Flower Exhibition Centre or exploring the tranquil paths of Ban Jhakri Falls Park, you'll find countless spots that beckon for a snapshot.

As you traverse the city, don’t miss the chance to visit iconic landmarks like the Do Drul Chorten and the Ganesh Tok temple, both of which offer unique perspectives of the surrounding landscape. The Gangtok Ropeway provides a thrilling aerial view of the city, while the peaceful Gonjang Monastery invites you to pause and reflect. With a mix of well-known attractions and hidden gems, Gangtok is a place where every click of the camera tells a story. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the stunning photo opportunities that await you in this enchanting hill station.
